alert.note: Alert for Pennington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 3:32PM MDT until July 07 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL PENNINGTON COUNTY... At 332 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen over the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, roads and streets as well as other drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochford, Mystic and Castle Peak Campground. This includes the following streams and drainages... Newton Fork, Silver Creek, Slate Creek, Prairie Creek, Bittersweet Creek, North Fork Castle Creek, Spring Creek, Castle Creek, South Fork Rapid Creek, North Fork Rapid Creek, Rapid Creek between Deerfield and Pactola Reservoirs, and Gimlet Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
